sen.j: 坂上正野（さかのうえ の まさの）は、坂上田村麻呂の四男。
sen.e: SAKANOUE no Masano was the forth son of SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro.
SAKANOUE no Masano was the forth son of SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro.
SAKANOUE no Masano was the forth son of SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro.
He was the captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards and the chief priest at Kiyomizu-dera Temple.
He was the captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards and the chief priest at Kiyomizu-dera Temple.
He was the captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards and the chief priest at Kiyomizu-dera Temple.

sen.j: 子に坂上実雄（左衛門尉）と坂上貞雄（侍従）がおり、貞雄の子に坂上正仁（内舎人）、その子に坂上正実（鎮守府軍監）がいる。
sen.e: He had sons, SAKANOUE no Saneo (a third-ranked officer of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) and SAKANOUE no Sadao (a chamberlain), and Sadao's son was SAKANOUE no Masahito (Ministerial equerries), and his son was SAKANOUE no Masazane [a supervisor of the army of "chinjufu" (Pacification and Defense Headquarters].

He had sons, SAKANOUE no Saneo (a third-ranked officer of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) and SAKANOUE no Sadao (a chamberlain), and Sadao's son was SAKANOUE no Masahito (Ministerial equerriy), and the son of Masahito was SAKANOUE no Masazane (a supervisor of the army of "chinjufu" [Pacification and Defense Headquarters]).
sen.cmt: his son→the son of Masahito,Ministerial equerries→Ministerial equerry と修正し、カッコ部分を修正しました。
sen.e: He had sons, SAKANOUE no Saneo (a third-ranked officer of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) and SAKANOUE no Sadao (a chamberlain), and Sadao's son was SAKANOUE no Masahito (Ministerial equerriy), and the son of Masahito was SAKANOUE no Masazane (a supervisor of the army of "chinjufu" [Pacification and Defense Headquarters]).
